Class ec.plubar.Ingredient 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.plubar.Ingredient
public abstract class Ingredient
extends Object
The base class for all ingredients in the new Plubar model. The Unum class deals with tables of these Ingredients.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Chip Morningstar, Karl Schumaker

IAmTheHost
A flag indicating if this Ingredient resides in a host Unum.
myBaseState
The state bundle for this Ingredient; set by public method init(istBase) and retrieved by getClientState().
myHostSet
A flag indicating whether or not IAmTheHost has been set, preventing multiple changes of IAmTheHost.
myName
The name of this kind of Ingredient; used for labeling and debug purposes only at this time (3/9/98).
myUnum
The Unum in which this instance of Ingredient resides; set by package method setUnum(), called by Unum#setIngredient().

Ingredient()
The basic constructor for an Ingredient: does nothing special at this time (3/9/98).

getClientState()
Used to get the states of ingredients and put them in a Hashtable for encoding purposes.
getNeighbor(String)
Calls getNeighbor() on this Ingredient's myUnum variable and returns the result, or catches the UnumExeption (meaning there was no ingredient named 'neighbor' in the Unum) and returns a null.
haveNeighbor(String)
Test if a particular neighbor exists by calling Unum.getNeighbor(), returning true if the ingredient exists, or catching the UnumException if not and returning false.
init()
For programmer-provided initialization, this method is automatically called by init(istBase).
init(istBase)
For standard initialization, called from Unum#init().
neighborSend(String, String, Object[])
Deliver a message to one of the ingredient's neighbors by calling up into myUnum.getNeighbor() and calling send() on the result.
send(String, Object[])
A bogus method used for sending messages until we get ERun.deliver.
setHost(boolean)
Tell this ingredient whether it is part of the host unum.
setName(String)
A bogus method used for labeling and debugging only.
setUnum(Unum)
Tell this ingredient what unum it is a part of.

IAmTheHost 
 protected boolean IAmTheHost
A flag indicating if this Ingredient resides in a host Unum.

myHostSet 
 protected boolean myHostSet
A flag indicating whether or not IAmTheHost has been set, preventing multiple changes of IAmTheHost.

See Also:
setHost
myBaseState 
 protected istBase myBaseState
The state bundle for this Ingredient; set by public method init(istBase) and retrieved by getClientState(). While children of Ingredient may have their own instance variables for children of istBase, this variable insures that the istBase variable sent into the init() method is what gets returned by getClientState().

myName 
 protected String myName
The name of this kind of Ingredient; used for labeling and debug purposes only at this time (3/9/98).

myUnum 
 protected Unum myUnum
The Unum in which this instance of Ingredient resides; set by package method setUnum(), called by Unum#setIngredient().

Ingredient 
 public Ingredient()
The basic constructor for an Ingredient: does nothing special at this time (3/9/98).

setUnum 
 void setUnum(Unum unum) throws UnumException
Tell this ingredient what unum it is a part of. Callable only from within the package. The only caller should be the setIngredient() method of class Unum.

Parameters:
unum - The Unum to initialize instance variable myUnum with.
Throws: UnumException
if the Ingredient's unum is already set or if parameter unum is null
See Also:
setIngredient
setHost 
 void setHost(boolean isHost) throws UnumException
Tell this ingredient whether it is part of the host unum. Callable only from within the package. The only caller should be the setIngredient() method of class Unum and this method can only be called once without throwing an UnumException.

Parameters:
isHost - The value to initialize IAmTheHost with
Throws: UnumException
if the myHostSet is true, i.e. this method has been called before.
See Also:
setIngredient
getNeighbor 
 protected Ingredient getNeighbor(String neighbor)
Calls getNeighbor() on this Ingredient's myUnum variable and returns the result, or catches the UnumExeption (meaning there was no ingredient named 'neighbor' in the Unum) and returns a null.

Parameters:
neighbor - The name of the ingredient role of interest
Returns:
The object in that role, or null if there is not such object
See Also:
getNeighbor
haveNeighbor 
 protected boolean haveNeighbor(String neighbor)
Test if a particular neighbor exists by calling Unum.getNeighbor(), returning true if the ingredient exists, or catching the UnumException if not and returning false.

Parameters:
neighbor - The name of the ingredient role of the neighbor
Returns:
true if an ingredient has been assigned to that role
See Also:
getNeighbor
neighborSend 
 protected void neighborSend(String neighbor,
                             String message,
                             Object args[]) throws UnumException
Deliver a message to one of the ingredient's neighbors by calling up into myUnum.getNeighbor() and calling send() on the result.

Parameters:
neighbor - Role name of neighbor to deliver message to
message - Message to deliver
args - Message arguments
Throws: UnumException
from Unum.getNeighbor()
See Also:
getNeighbor, send
getClientState 
 final istBase getClientState()
Used to get the states of ingredients and put them in a Hashtable for encoding purposes. Called from Unum.createClientSoulState()

Returns:
The instance variable myBaseState
See Also:
createClientSoulState
init 
 protected abstract void init()
For programmer-provided initialization, this method is automatically called by init(istBase).

See Also:
init
init 
 final void init(istBase state) throws UnumException
For standard initialization, called from Unum#init(). This init routine guarantees that the myBaseState variable returned in getClientState() gets initialized with an istBase object, and then calls the user-defined abstract init().

Parameters:
state - The initial state for this ingredient.
Throws: UnumException
If this Ingredient has already been initialized
See Also:
getClientState, init
setName 
 void setName(String name) throws UnumException
A bogus method used for labeling and debugging only.

Parameters:
name - The name for this ingredient.
Throws: UnumException
If this Ingredient has already been named
send 
 public void send(String message,
                  Object args[])
A bogus method used for sending messages until we get ERun.deliver.

Parameters:
message - The name of the method to send.
args - The arguments for message.
